net.dean.jraw.http.oauth

Class OAuthHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.dean.jraw.http.oauth.OAuthHelper
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    NetworkAccessible

    public class OAuthHelper
extends java.lang.Object
implements NetworkAccessible

    This class assists developers using this library in authenticating users via OAuth2. For the app types of 'installed' or 'web', a typical use of this class is as follows:

    1. Obtain an authorization URL using getAuthorizationUrl(String, String, boolean, String...).
    2. Point the user's browser to that URL and have the user login and then press either 'yes' or 'no' on the authentication form. The URL that the browser redirects to will be your app's redirect URI with some arguments in the query.
    3. Provide this data as well as an instance of Credentials to onUserChallenge(String, String, Credentials). This method will parse the query arguments and report any errors. Once the response's integrity has been verified, a request to obtain the OAuth access code will be made and an instance of OAuthData retrieved.

    Authentication is simpler when the app type is 'script', as this enables the bypassing of showing the initial authorization URL to the user. However, it comes at the cost of only being able to log into the accounts of users registered as "developers." To authenticate with a 'script' app, one may simply use doScriptApp(Credentials).

    • Method Detail

      • getAuthorizationUrl

        public java.net.URL getAuthorizationUrl(java.lang.String clientId,
                               java.lang.String redirectUri,
                               boolean permanent,
                               java.lang.String... scopes)
        Generates a URL used to authorize a user using OAuth2 'installed' or 'web' type app.
        Parameters:
        clientId - The app's client ID
        redirectUri - The app's redirect URI. Must match exactly as in the app settings.
        permanent - Whether or not to request a 'refresh' token which can be exchanged for an additional Authorization token in the future.
        scopes - OAuth scopes to be requested. A full list of scopes can be found here.
        Returns:
        The URL clients are sent to in order to authorize themselves

      • onUserChallenge

        public OAuthData onUserChallenge(java.lang.String finalUrl,
                        java.lang.String redirectUri,
                        Credentials creds)
                          throws NetworkException,
                                 OAuthException,
                                 java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                                 java.net.MalformedURLException
        Used obtain an access token for 'web' or 'installed' app types. This method parses the query arguments passed to this URI. If no error is present and the 'state' code matches the one most recently generated, then an access token is requested.
        Parameters:
        redirectUri - The app's redirect URI. Must match exactly as in the app settings.
        finalUrl - The URL that the HTTP client redirected to after the user chose either to authorize or not authorize the application. This will be the app's redirect URI with the addition of a few query parameters.
        creds - The credentials to retrieve the access token with. If the authorization method is AuthenticationMethod.SCRIPT, stop what you're doing and use doScriptApp(Credentials) instead.
        Returns:
        An AuthData that holds the new access token among other things
        Throws:
        OAuthException - If there was a problem with any of the parameters given
        NetworkException - If the request was not successful
        java.net.MalformedURLException - If finalUrl is not a valid URL
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the state last generated with getAuthorizationUrl(String, String, boolean, String...) did not match the value of the 'state' query parameter.

      • doScriptApp

        public OAuthData doScriptApp(Credentials credentials)
                      throws NetworkException
        Authorizes a 'script' app by utilizing a shortcut specific to Reddit's OAuth2 implementation which allows 'script' apps to skip the authorization prompt in-browser and directly authorize with their Reddit username and password and the app's client ID and secret. However, only users listed as developers of the app my be authorized. This method is most frequently used to authorize a user in a headless environment or a bot.
        Parameters:
        credentials - The credentials to use. The authentication method must be AuthenticationMethod.SCRIPT.
        Returns:
        The data returned from the authorization request
        Throws:
        NetworkException - If the request was not successful

      • doApplicationOnly

        public OAuthData doApplicationOnly(Credentials credentials)
                            throws NetworkException,
                                   OAuthException
        Authenticates using application-only OAuth2 (in a user-less context).
        Parameters:
        credentials - The app's credentials. The authentication method must be userless.
        Returns:
        The data returned from the authorization request
        Throws:
        NetworkException - If the request was not successful
        OAuthException
